docs.text: ConfIDent-schema This is a schema for the ConfIDent project that describes the necessary metadata requirements of academic events and event series. URI: https://tibhannover.github.io/ConfIDent_schema/ Classes Class Description SchemaBasedThing A mixin used in classes that contain schema based values, such as the classifications used to denote the academic field of an event or the external identifiers used to denote a thing. NamedThing A mixin used to provide the attributes needed for the identification of named class. PlannedProcess Abstract base class for academic events and event series. AcademicEventSeries An academic event series describes the set of academic events which take place on a regular basis and thus have an established common identity. This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time. AcademicEvent An academic event is part of the established instruments of science communication as a format for conveying the latest scientific publications. It is defined by the meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss these publications. In contrast to other forms of events, academic events should primarily serve the exchange of results and methods of scientific research and their didactic mediation. Furthermore, a significant participation of scientific organizations in the realization of an academic event is constitutive for this type of event; for example, to distinguish it from events in which researchers mainly act as external experts or with a purely legitimising function. ProcessName The container for the various names denoting a planned process ExternalIdentifier An identifer of an entity declared in another schema. DigitalObjectId A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify digital objects given by International DOI Foundation. WikidataId The identifier of a thing (item) in Wikidata. GndId The identifier of a thing (item) in the German National authority file. TibkatId The identifier of a publication in the TIB catalog. DblpId The identifier of an academic event or series in dblp. WikiCfpId The identifier of an academic event or series in WikiCFP. EventFormatSpecification An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree. Deadline A container for event deadlines. Metric A container for statistical information about a planned process. ProcessRelation A container for relations between academic events. Location A container for the information about the location in which an academic event takes place. City The city in which an academic event takes place. Country The country in which an academic event takes place. Region The region in which an academic event takes place. For non USA events this might often be negligible. Venue The venue at which an academic event takes place. AcademicField An academic field is the scientific subject of a planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus and as such requires the scheme URI. Context A container to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. Contributor A contributor is a person or organization that holds a contributor role which is being realized in a planned process. Sponsor A person or an organization whose role it is to sponsor an academic event or event series. Attendee A person whose only role it is to attend an academic event. Moderator A person that has the role to moderate an academic event. Reviewer A person that has the role to review the submissions of an academic event. Organizer An organizer of an academic event or event series. ContactPerson The contact person of an academic event or event series. CommitteeMember A members of an academic event committee. CommitteeChair The head of an academic event committee. Presenter A person that presents its work at an academic event. KeynoteSpeaker A 'keynote speaker' is a presenter that is an invited person - often a multiplier in his or her (research) field - responsible for delivering a keynote speech. Publication A published work, e.g. proceedings or conferenc paper, that is the output of an academic event or series. ConfIDentRecords A container to be able to bundle academic event data and series in one data file (e.g. YAML or JSON). Slots Slot Description type An abstract property that is reused in certain classes to differentiate their instances according to the type enums defined as the range. doi A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/. gnd_id None wikidata_id A property to link an entity with its Wikidata identifier. name A property to provide a name of a schema entity. id A property to provide an internal id of a schema entity in the ConfIDent plattform. external_ids A property to provide an external id of a schema entity. value a property to provide the literal value of a schema based entity. schema_name None schema_base_uri The base URI of the schema that provides the context for the schema based value. landing_page A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series. organizers A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series. academic_fields A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory. website A property to provide the URL the official website of a planned process. sponsors None publications The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. topics A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text. metrics A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series. context_info A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. wikicfp_id A property to link a planned process with its WikiCFP identifier. dpbl_id A property to link the a planned process with its DBLP identifier. series_of A property to link to the events that are part of an academic event series. start_date The start date of an academic event or event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series. end_date Similar to start_date but only for the end of an academic event or event series. event_status None in_series The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part. event_format None at_location The location of the academic event. deadlines A property to provide deadlines of an academic event. related_to A property to be used ordinal The ordnial number of an academic event within its series. event_mode The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event. official_name The official name of an academic event or series. acronym The official acronym of an academic event or series. former_name The former official name of an academic event or series. Usually this will only be needed in case an academic event series has undergone a name change. translated_name A translation of the official process name to be used in different language contexts. aliases A property to provide alternative names of a planned process. specified_as A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of EventType . deadline_date The date of a deadline. deadline_other A property to specify another type of deadline, if this type of deadline is not within the allowed values of DeadlineType . int_value A property to provide an integer value for a metric. str_value A property to provide a string value for a metric. rate_value A property to provide a rate value as float for a metric. truth_value A property to provide a truth value for a metric. description A property to provide a description of a metric. city The property to specify the City of an academic event location. country The property to specify the Country of an academic event location. region The property to specify the Region of an academic event location. venue The property to specify the Venue of an academic event location. lattitude The property to specify the lattitude of an academic event location. longitude The property to specify the longitude of an academic event location. meeting_url The property to specify the URL under which a one can participate virtually in an academic event. street The street of the venue including the house number seperated by comma. zip_code The zip code of the venue. text The free text used to provide more context information on a planned process. license_str The license of the context information as text, which must be used when copying text from other sources. license_url The license of the context information as URL, which should be used when copying text from other sources and such a URL exists. contact The contact person of an academic event or event series. email The email address of the contact person. telephone The telephone number of the contact person. events A property to provide a list of academic events within this container. series A property to provide a list of academic event series within this container. Enums Enums Description EventType The most common minimal event types. For event types that are not in this list, you can use "other" and provide the label of this other event format using the event_format property. EventStatus The status of the academic event which indicates if it takes place as planned. EventMode An enum to specify if an academic event is in person, virtual or a hybrid of both. DeadlineType An enum that specifies the possible kinds of deadlines of an academic event. RelationType The kinds of relations that are allowed between academic events. MetricType The possible metric of an academic event. ContributorType An enumaration used to distinguish the contributors of a planned process with regard to them being either an organization or a person.
docs.title: Index

docs.title: Academic Event

docs.text: An academic event is part of the established instruments of science communication as a format for conveying the latest scientific publications. It is defined by the meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss these publications. In contrast to other forms of events, academic events should primarily serve the exchange of results and methods of scientific research and their didactic mediation. Furthermore, a significant participation of scientific organizations in the realization of an academic event is constitutive for this type of event; for example, to distinguish it from events in which researchers mainly act as external experts or with a purely legitimising function. URI: confident:AcademicEvent

Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series. . end_date datetime 1..1 recommended Similar to start_date but only for the end of an academic event or event series. . event_status EventStatus 1..1 None . in_series AcademicEventSeries 0..1 recommended The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part. . event_format EventFormatSpecification 0..1 recommended None . at_location Location 0..1 recommended The location of the academic event. . deadlines Deadline 0..* recommended A property to provide deadlines of an academic event. . related_to ProcessRelation 0..* recommended A property to be used . ordinal integer 0..1 The ordnial number of an academic event within its series. . event_mode EventMode 0..1 The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event. . type EventType 0..1 recommended A property to specify the subtype of the academic event according to a controlled list defined in EventType . If the . doi DigitalObjectId 0..* recommended A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/. . landing_page uri 0..1 recommended A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series. . organizers Organizer 0..* recommended A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series. . academic_fields AcademicField 0..* recommended A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory. . website uri 0..1 recommended A property to provide the URL the official website of an academic event. . sponsors Sponsor 0..* recommended A property to provide the sponsors of an academic event. . publications Publication 0..* recommended The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. . wikidata_id WikidataId 0..* A property to link an academic event with its Wikidata identifier . . wikicfp_id WikiCfpId 0..* A property to link an academic event with its WikiCFP identifier . . dpbl_id DblpId 0..* A property to link an academic event with its DBLP identifier . . gnd_id DblpId 0..* A property to link an academic event with its GND identifier . . topics string 0..* A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text. . metrics Metric 0..* A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series. . context_info Context 0..1 A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. . id uriorcurie 1..1 A property to provide an internal id of a schema entity in the ConfIDent plattform. . name ProcessName 1..1 The name of an academic event. . external_ids ExternalIdentifier 0..* A property to provide a list of external identifiers including their identifier scheme. .

docs.title: Induced

docs.text: Class: AcademicEventSeries An academic event series describes the set of academic events which take place on a regular basis and thus have an established common identity. This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time. URI: aeon:0000002 Inheritance PlannedProcess [ NamedThing] AcademicEventSeries Slots Name Range Cardinality Description Info series_of AcademicEvent 0..1 recommended A property to link to the events that are part of an academic event series. . type string 0..1 An abstract property that is reused in certain classes to differentiate their instances according to the type enums defined as the range. . doi DigitalObjectId 0..* recommended A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/. . landing_page uri 0..1 recommended A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series. . organizers Organizer 0..* recommended A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series. . academic_fields AcademicField 0..* recommended A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory. . website uri 0..1 recommended A property to provide the URL the official website of an academic event series. . sponsors Sponsor 0..* recommended A property to provide the sponsors of an academic event series. . publications Publication 0..* recommended The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. . wikidata_id WikidataId 0..* A property to link an academic event series with its Wikidata identifier . . wikicfp_id WikiCfpId 0..* A property to link an academic event series with its WikiCFP identifier . . dpbl_id DblpId 0..* A property to link an academic event series with its DBLP identifier . . gnd_id DblpId 0..* A property to link an academic event series with its GND identifier . . topics string 0..* A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text. . metrics Metric 0..* A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series. . context_info Context 0..1 A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. . id uriorcurie 1..1 A property to provide an internal id of a schema entity in the ConfIDent plattform. . name ProcessName 1..1 A property to provide a name of a schema entity. . external_ids ExternalIdentifier 0..* The property to provide external identifiers including their identifier scheme. . This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time. URI: aeon:0000002

docs.text: ConfIDent-schema metamodel version: 1.7.0 version: 0.3.0 This is a schema for the ConfIDent project that describes the necessary metadata requirements of academic events and event series. Classes AcademicField - An academic field is the scientific subject of a planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus and as such requires the scheme URI. City - The city in which an academic event takes place. ConfIDentRecords - A container to be able to bundle academic event data and series in one data file (e.g. YAML or JSON). Context - A container to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. Contributor - A contributor is a person or organization that holds a contributor role which is being realized in a planned process. Attendee - A person whose only role it is to attend an academic event. Moderator - A person that has the role to moderate an academic event. Organizer - An organizer of an academic event or event series. CommitteeMember - A members of an academic event committee. CommitteeChair - The head of an academic event committee. ContactPerson - The contact person of an academic event or event series. Presenter - A person that presents its work at an academic event. KeynoteSpeaker - A 'keynote speaker' is a presenter that is an invited person - often a multiplier in his or her (research) field - responsible for delivering a keynote speech. Reviewer - A person that has the role to review the submissions of an academic event. Sponsor - A person or an organization whose role it is to sponsor an academic event or event series. Country - The country in which an academic event takes place. Deadline - A container for event deadlines. EventFormatSpecification - An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree. ExternalIdentifier - An identifer of an entity declared in another schema. DblpId - The identifier of an academic event or series in dblp. DigitalObjectId - A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify digital objects given by International DOI Foundation. GndId - The identifier of a thing (item) in the German National authority file. TibkatId - The identifier of a publication in the TIB catalog. WikiCfpId - The identifier of an academic event or series in WikiCFP. WikidataId - The identifier of a thing (item) in Wikidata. Location - A container for the information about the location in which an academic event takes place. Metric - A container for statistical information about a planned process. PlannedProcess - Abstract base class for academic events and event series. AcademicEvent - An academic event is part of the established instruments of science communication as a format for conveying the latest scientific publications. It is defined by the meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss these publications. In contrast to other forms of events, academic events should primarily serve the exchange of results and methods of scientific research and their didactic mediation. Furthermore, a significant participation of scientific organizations in the realization of an academic event is constitutive for this type of event; for example, to distinguish it from events in which researchers mainly act as external experts or with a purely legitimising function. AcademicEventSeries - An academic event series describes the set of academic events which take place on a regular basis and thus have an established common identity. This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time. ProcessName - The container for the various names denoting a planned process ProcessRelation - A container for relations between academic events. Publication - A published work, e.g. proceedings or conferenc paper, that is the output of an academic event or series. Region - The region in which an academic event takes place. For non USA events this might often be negligible. Venue - The venue at which an academic event takes place. Mixins NamedThing - A mixin used to provide the attributes needed for the identification of named class. SchemaBasedThing - A mixin used in classes that contain schema based values, such as the classifications used to denote the academic field of an event or the external identifiers used to denote a thing. AcademicEvent➞deadlines - A property to provide deadlines of an academic event. AcademicEvent➞end_date - Similar to start_date but only for the end of an academic event or event series. AcademicEvent➞event_format AcademicEvent➞event_mode - The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event. AcademicEvent➞event_status AcademicEvent➞in_series - The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part. ➞index AcademicEvent➞ordinal - The ordnial number of an academic event within its series. AcademicEvent➞related_to - A property to be used AcademicEvent➞start_date - The start date of an academic event or event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series. academic_fields - A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory. AcademicEventSeries➞academic_fields AcademicEvent➞academic_fields ConfIDentRecords➞events - A property to provide a list of academic events within this container. ConfIDentRecords➞series - A property to provide a list of academic event series within this container. contact - The contact person of an academic event or event series. ContactPerson➞email - The email address of the contact person. ContactPerson➞telephone - The telephone number of the contact person. Context➞license_str - The license of the context information as text, which must be used when copying text from other sources. Context➞license_url - The license of the context information as URL, which should be used when copying text from other sources and such a URL exists. Context➞text - The free text used to provide more context information on a planned process. context_info - A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. AcademicEventSeries➞context_info AcademicEvent➞context_info Deadline➞deadline_date - The date of a deadline. Deadline➞deadline_other - A property to specify another type of deadline, if this type of deadline is not within the allowed values of DeadlineType . EventFormatSpecification➞specified_as - A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of EventType . external_id - A property to provide an external id of a schema entity. doi - A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/. AcademicEventSeries➞doi AcademicEvent➞doi dpbl_id - A property to link the a planned process with its DBLP identifier. AcademicEventSeries➞dpbl_id - A property to link an academic event series with its DBLP identifier . AcademicEvent➞dpbl_id - A property to link an academic event with its DBLP identifier . gnd_id AcademicEventSeries➞gnd_id - A property to link an academic event series with its GND identifier . AcademicEvent➞gnd_id - A property to link an academic event with its GND identifier . wikicfp_id - A property to link a planned process with its WikiCFP identifier. AcademicEventSeries➞wikicfp_id - A property to link an academic event series with its WikiCFP identifier . AcademicEvent➞wikicfp_id - A property to link an academic event with its WikiCFP identifier . wikidata_id - A property to link an entity with its Wikidata identifier. AcademicEventSeries➞wikidata_id - A property to link an academic event series with its Wikidata identifier . AcademicEvent➞wikidata_id - A property to link an academic event with its Wikidata identifier . id - A property to provide an internal id of a schema entity in the ConfIDent plattform. AcademicEventSeries➞id AcademicEvent➞id ContactPerson➞id - The autogenerated internal identifier of contact person. landing_page - A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series. AcademicEventSeries➞landing_page AcademicEvent➞landing_page Location➞city - The property to specify the City of an academic event location. Location➞country - The property to specify the Country of an academic event location. Location➞lattitude - The property to specify the lattitude of an academic event location. Location➞longitude - The property to specify the longitude of an academic event location. Location➞meeting_url - The property to specify the URL under which a one can participate virtually in an academic event. Location➞region - The property to specify the Region of an academic event location. Location➞venue - The property to specify the Venue of an academic event location. Metric➞description - A property to provide a description of a metric. Metric➞int_value - A property to provide an integer value for a metric. Metric➞rate_value - A property to provide a rate value as float for a metric. Metric➞str_value - A property to provide a string value for a metric. Metric➞truth_value - A property to provide a truth value for a metric. metrics - A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series. AcademicEventSeries➞metrics AcademicEvent➞metrics name - A property to provide a name of a schema entity. ProcessName➞acronym - The official acronym of an academic event or series. ProcessName➞aliases - A property to provide alternative names of a planned process. ProcessName➞former_name - The former official name of an academic event or series. Usually this will only be needed in case an academic event series has undergone a name change. ProcessName➞official_name - The official name of an academic event or series. ProcessName➞translated_name - A translation of the official process name to be used in different language contexts. ➞contact - The contact person of an academic event or event series. organizers - A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series. AcademicEventSeries➞organizers AcademicEvent➞organizers process_name - A property to provide a name of the academic event or series, which itself if further differentiated (e.g. official name, acronym, etc). AcademicEventSeries➞process_name AcademicEvent➞process_name publications - The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. AcademicEventSeries➞publications AcademicEvent➞publications schema_base_uri - The base URI of the schema that provides the context for the schema based value. AcademicEvent➞sponsors - A property to provide the sponsors of an academic event. topics - A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text. AcademicEventSeries➞topics AcademicEvent➞topics type - An abstract property that is reused in certain classes to differentiate their instances according to the type enums defined as the range. AcademicEvent➞type - A property to specify the subtype of the academic event according to a controlled list defined in EventType . Metric➞type - A property to provide the type of relation between academic events. DeadlineType - An enum that specifies the possible kinds of deadlines of an academic event. EventMode - An enum to specify if an academic event is in person, virtual or a hybrid of both. EventStatus - The status of the academic event which indicates if it takes place as planned. EventType - The most common minimal event types. For event types that are not in this list, you can use "other" and provide the label of this other event format using the event_format property. MetricType - The possible metric of an academic event. RelationType - The kinds of relations that are allowed between academic events. docs.title: ConfIDent-schema

docs.text: metamodel version: 1.7.0 version: 0.3.0 This is a schema for the ConfIDent project that describes the necessary metadata requirements of academic events and event series.
docs.title: ConfIDent-schema

docs.text: AcademicField - An academic field is the scientific subject of a planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus and as such requires the scheme URI. City - The city in which an academic event takes place. ConfIDentRecords - A container to be able to bundle academic event data and series in one data file (e.g. YAML or JSON). Context - A container to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. Contributor - A contributor is a person or organization that holds a contributor role which is being realized in a planned process. Attendee - A person whose only role it is to attend an academic event. Moderator - A person that has the role to moderate an academic event. Organizer - An organizer of an academic event or event series. CommitteeMember - A members of an academic event committee. CommitteeChair - The head of an academic event committee. ContactPerson - The contact person of an academic event or event series. Presenter - A person that presents its work at an academic event. KeynoteSpeaker - A 'keynote speaker' is a presenter that is an invited person - often a multiplier in his or her (research) field - responsible for delivering a keynote speech. Reviewer - A person that has the role to review the submissions of an academic event. Sponsor - A person or an organization whose role it is to sponsor an academic event or event series. Country - The country in which an academic event takes place. Deadline - A container for event deadlines. EventFormatSpecification - An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree. ExternalIdentifier - An identifer of an entity declared in another schema. DblpId - The identifier of an academic event or series in dblp. DigitalObjectId - A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify digital objects given by International DOI Foundation. GndId - The identifier of a thing (item) in the German National authority file. TibkatId - The identifier of a publication in the TIB catalog. WikiCfpId - The identifier of an academic event or series in WikiCFP. WikidataId - The identifier of a thing (item) in Wikidata. Location - A container for the information about the location in which an academic event takes place. Metric - A container for statistical information about a planned process. PlannedProcess - Abstract base class for academic events and event series. AcademicEvent - An academic event is part of the established instruments of science communication as a format for conveying the latest scientific publications. It is defined by the meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss these publications. In contrast to other forms of events, academic events should primarily serve the exchange of results and methods of scientific research and their didactic mediation. Furthermore, a significant participation of scientific organizations in the realization of an academic event is constitutive for this type of event; for example, to distinguish it from events in which researchers mainly act as external experts or with a purely legitimising function. AcademicEventSeries - An academic event series describes the set of academic events which take place on a regular basis and thus have an established common identity. This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time. ProcessName - The container for the various names denoting a planned process ProcessRelation - A container for relations between academic events. Publication - A published work, e.g. proceedings or conferenc paper, that is the output of an academic event or series. Region - The region in which an academic event takes place. For non USA events this might often be negligible. Venue - The venue at which an academic event takes place.

docs.text: Class: EventFormatSpecification An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree. URI: aeon:0000004 Slots Name Range Cardinality Description Info specified_as string 1..1 A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of EventType . . It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree. from_schema : https://tibhannover.github.io/ConfIDent_schema/ attributes : specified_as : name : specified_as description : A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of [EventType](EventType). examples : - value : ad-hoc meeting of university presidents description : An example to provide a format specification for special type of academic event that is not in the schema's [EventType](EventType) enum. from_schema : https://tibhannover.github.io/ConfIDent_schema/ domain : EventFormatSpecification slot_uri : obi:0002815 range : string required : true class_uri : aeon:0000004 Induced name : EventFormatSpecification description : An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. docs.text: EventType The most common minimal event types. For event types that are not in this list, you can use "other" and provide the label of this other event format using the event_format property. URI: EventType Permissible Values Value Meaning Description Info colloquium aeon:0000101 A colloquium is an academic meeting that usually lasts only a few hours and serves to discuss a specific topic. Colloquia are usually part of the academic exchange in everyday university life with only one speaker, but can also take place on special occasions (anniversaries, start or end of the lecture phase, etc.) and can have more than one speaker. conference aeon:0000103 A conference is an academic event that lasts up to several days and serves as a forum for presentations on a specific topic or subject area. In addition to subject-specific conferences, there are also interdisciplinary conferences which allow both a broader focus and more specific questions on a particular (academic) problem. Conferences often have a highly formalized structure of parallel, clearly defined sessions with several short presentations and plenary sessions with invited (keynote) speakers who are considered multipliers in their (research) field. Ideally, the selection of the speakers and their contributions is subject to a review process. congress aeon:0000123 A congress is a certain type of conference which is characterised by a larger number of participants (often several hundred) and is oftentimes organised jointly by large, established (e.g. specialised societies) and/or several institutions. Congresses have a broader thematic focus than simple conferences, take place in certain cycles, but can still target an exclusive group of participants (e.g. representatives of a single discipline). session aeon:0000111 A session is a clearly defined part of a academic event in which a small number of speakers (usually 2-5) focus on a specific topic. A session is usually formally accompanied by a session chair, who assumes the function of a moderator. poster session aeon:0000127 A poster session is a session at which poster papers are presented. talk aeon:0000125 A talk is a central part of a larger academic event, at which a specific topic is being presented in a rather short way. keynote speech aeon:00001115 A keynote speech is a special talk that has the function to set the underlying tone and summarize the core message or most important revelation of the academic event at which it is given. event track aeon:00001117 An academic event that, as a part of a larger academic event, has the function to group even smaller parts of the academic event, like sessions and talks, according to a shared theme or topic. It usually has dedicated chairs and program committees. forum aeon:0000105 An academic event whose sociocultural format is determined in an academic event type specification that classifies the academic event as a forum. hackathon aeon:0000107 A hackathon is a gathering of software developers with the goal to develop software collaboratively in a short timeframe. seminar aeon:0000109 A seminar can serve as a term for older conference series, but in current usage the term mainly describes a specific teaching format that serves to develop content and provides space for discussion. Participation from the audience is usually encouraged. symposium aeon:0000113 A symposium is a specific type of conference with a narrower thematic focus, with fewer participants and of shorter duration. The degree of structuring lies between a classic conference and a workshop, allows more discussion than the larger conference, but is usually more formalized than the workshop. tutorial aeon:0000119 An academic event that has the function to educate the audience on a certain topic. A tutorial is often realized as an academic event talk or academic event session. workshop aeon:0000121 Workshops are smaller academic events that serve to exchange information on a specific topic or problem. They usually last one or two days and offer space for discussion and the development of content and solutions. Group work is often part of the event concept. other aeon:0000001 This value is to be used if the event format cannot be represented using one of the other permissible values defined in the EventFormat enum. If this value is chosen the use of other_format is mandatory. Identifier and Mapping Information
docs.title: EventType

docs.text: The most common minimal event types. For event types that are not in this list, you can use "other" and provide the label of this other event format using the event_format property. URI: EventType

docs.text: Class: PlannedProcess Abstract base class for academic events and event series. NOTE : this is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly URI: obi:0000011 Inheritance PlannedProcess [ NamedThing] AcademicEventSeries AcademicEvent Slots Name Range Cardinality Description Info type string 0..1 An abstract property that is reused in certain classes to differentiate their instances according to the type enums defined as the range. . doi DigitalObjectId 0..* A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/. . landing_page uri 0..1 A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series. . organizers Organizer 0..* A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series. . academic_fields AcademicField 0..* A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory. . website uri 0..1 A property to provide the URL the official website of a planned process. . sponsors Sponsor 0..* None . publications string 0..* The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. . wikidata_id WikidataId 0..* A property to link an entity with its Wikidata identifier. . wikicfp_id WikiCfpId 0..* A property to link a planned process with its WikiCFP identifier. . dpbl_id DblpId 0..* A property to link the a planned process with its DBLP identifier. . gnd_id GndId 0..* None . topics string 0..* A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text. . metrics Metric 0..* A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series. . context_info Context 0..1 A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description. . id uriorcurie 0..1 The identifier of a PlannedProcess. . name ProcessName 1..1 The relatin to relate a name to a PlannedProcess. . external_ids ExternalIdentifier 0..* A property to provide an external id of a schema entity. .
